wikipedia_page.main:
Pamela June Crook  (born 1945), known professionally as P J Crook, is an English painter and sculptor. Her shows have appeared in  London,  France, the United States, Japan, Canada, and Estonia. Her professional name "P J Crook" lacks full stops; variant stylings such as "P. J. Crook" have appeared.
Crook was born in 1945 in Cheltenham, England, where she still lives. She is represented by the Panter & Hall gallery on Pall Mall in London and Galerie Alain Blondel in Paris.

response: *P. J. Crook – paintings "Absent Lovers I & II"

Like the covers of many King Crimson albums, The Night Watch's cover features a painting by P. J. Crook, which is also entitled The Nightwatch. The sleeve was designed by the Bill Smith Studio of London.
* P. J. Crook (Painter owning copyrights to album covers)
*P. J. Crook (born 1945), artist, was born and lives in Cheltenham.

Robsinden also argues, "It's really not appropriate to include artists, so I've removed the template from Matthews' page" and s/he's removed Rodney Matthews from the navbox. I don't see why it is "not appropriate" to include Matthews and Dean, both artists with long-standing close relationships with Asia. I note, as a comparison, that Template:King Crimson includes artist P. J. Crook and Template:Rush includes Hugh Syme, although Template:Yes (band) doesn't include Dean.
